newsitem.title: USA: Wash. 1,158 MW nuke seen at full power Mon or Tues.
newsitem.headline: Wash. 1,158 MW nuke seen at full power Mon or Tues.

text.p: The 1,158 megawatt WNP-2 nuclear power plant in Washington state is scheduled to reach full power next Monday or Tuesday following repairs to its cooling system, a spokesman for the plant said Thursday.
The Washington Public Power Supply System unit was taken off line early Thursday for the repair work, but its reactor continues to run at about 20 percent capacity, the spokesman noted.
The unit is expected to reconnect with the regional power grid later Thursday and ascend toward full power.
WNP-2, situated in Richland, Wash., has been in the process of returning to operation following its latest refueling and maintenance outage which began in late March.
